page.title: 16Recreation
page.content: Popular interests are gardening by men and women, horse-riding (young women), eating-out, occasional theatre visits, walking, golf, and watching television. Older women sew and knit, sometimes in aid of charities and bazaars. Younger housewives who often have a part or full time job, mainly relax in front of the television set. Teenage boys aim to buy motorbikes, in order to visit other villages or go to discoes. Reading is aided by mobile libraries which make brief stops at Playford, Bealings and Rushmere weekly. News comes via newspapers published in Ipswich and national papers, parish church magazines, advetisers free newspapers, local and national radio, and television. Two Ipswich clubs share a sports field in Rushmere, and Bealings has a bowling green.
